hanzi-su-wiki:
侍

Значения

Воин, самурай

Мнемоника

Воин 亻, защищающий храм 寺, и готовый на смелые поступки.
purpleculture_pinyin:
shì
to serve; to attend upon
служить; присутствовать на
rtega_mnemonic:
侍侍RSserve, attend upon, attendant, servant, samurai
  • person 亻 serving a temple 寺
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 寺 indicates the sound; 亻 (person) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
侍候 [ shì hòu ]: to serve; to wait upon
侍卫 [ shì wèi ]: Imperial bodyguard
侍者 [ shì zhě ]: attendant; waiter
侍奉 [ shì fèng ]: to wait upon; to serve; to attend to sb's needs
侍从 [ shì cóng ]: to serve (an important personage); attendant; retainer
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 亻 [ rén ] man, person; people
    • 寺 [ sì ] court, office; temple, monastery
heisig_chinese_memo: Mr. T likes to serve at the Buddhist temple sometimes. &nbsp
heisig_constituent: waiter, person, Buddhist temple, soil, dirt, ground, glue
heisig_story: Person . . . Buddhist temple. The key word is deceptively modern, but the kanji is actually another way of writing "samurai." Be careful not to confuse with attend (Frame 1033).
koohiiStory1: Mr. T infiltrates the secret samurai Buddhist temple as a waiter with a tray of green tea. (Careful: attend (#960)).
koohiiStory2: Remember the kanji for wait, 待. Well, now we have a waiter, and he´s dropped a dish. See: 侍! 待 crash 侍.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The leader of the temple isn't a monk like you'd expect. It's a samurai, who protects the monks in return for prayers that keep him safe.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: You walk up to a temple and you're surprised to find that there's a samurai guarding it. Talk to him for a while so he can tell you why he has been doing this job. He's quite a nice guy, actually.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The reading is samurai, which should be easy enough to remember.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: If you know the meaning you know the reading as well! That doesn't happen too often with kanji, so consider yourself lucky!
Ru_Notes: Фонетик: 寺 (てら、ジ храм). Не путать: 持 (もつ、ジ держать, иметь), 待 (まつ、タイ ждать).
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the man (亻) in the temple (寺) is a samurai
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Mr. T likes to serve at the Buddhist temple sometimes. &nbsp
humanum_full_description_en:
" Servant " follows the sound of " person " and " temple ", which means to serve and to accompany the venerable. "Said Wen": "Serve, inherit. From the person, the temple sound." Duan Yucai's note: "The inheritor, the honor, the accept. All the servants are respectful and respectful of the righteousness." "Liu Shu Gu. Ren Yi: "Serve, accompany the side." "The Analects. "Advanced": "Min Zi is on the side, and talks as if it is too." Xing Bingshu: "Being humble and calling on the side is called the servant.

The characters on the bamboo and silk are from the people from the temple, the people are the righteous symbols, and the temple is the sound symbol, which is the same as the Xiaozhuan. " Patient " can be used as " waiting ", meaning waiting. Such as "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Slips. "Closed Diagnosis Ceremony": "Serving (waiting) order". It also means " reliance ", which means relying on it. "Mawangdui. Laozi B this. "Tao Jing": "For the sake of Fu Shi (reliance), success and Fu Ju also." "Ritual. Shizhu Li": "The maid waits outdoors, and when you call it, you hear it." Zheng Xuan's note: "The present text serves as a waiter." See " Temple ", " Waiting ", " Reliance ".
humanum_short_description_en: " Servant " follows the sound of " person " and " temple ", which means serving and accompanying the venerable.
humanum_full_description:
「侍」從「人」，「寺」聲，表示侍奉，又有陪伴尊者之意。《說文》：「侍，承也。从人，寺聲。」段玉裁注：「承者，奉也，受也。凡言侍者，皆敬恭承奉之義。」《六書故．人一》：「侍，陪側也。」《論語．先進》：「閔子侍側，誾誾如也。」邢昺疏：「卑在尊側曰侍。」

　　簡帛文字從人從寺，人為義符，以表侍奉之意，寺為聲符，與小篆同。「侍」可通作「待」，表示等候。如《睡虎地秦簡．封診式》：「侍(待)令」。又通「恃」，表示憑借。《馬王堆．老子乙本．道經》：「為而弗侍(恃)也，成功而弗居也。」《儀禮．士昬禮》：「媵侍於戶外，呼則聞。」鄭玄注：「今文侍作待。」參見「寺」、「待」、「恃」。
humanum_short_description: 「侍」從「人」，「寺」聲，表示侍奉，又有陪伴尊者之意。

侍(さむらい): Samurai, warrior

「 侍 」從「 人 」，「 寺 」聲，表示侍奉，又有陪伴尊者之意。《說文》：「侍，承也。从人，寺聲。」段玉裁注：「承者，奉也，受也。凡言侍者，皆敬恭承奉之義。」《六書故．人一》：「侍，陪側也。」《論語．先進》：「閔子侍側，誾誾如也。」邢昺疏：「卑在尊側曰侍。」 簡帛文字從人從寺，人為義符，以表侍奉之意，寺為聲符，與小篆同。「 侍 」可通作「 待 」，表示等候。如《睡虎地秦簡．封診式》：「侍(待)令」。又通「 恃 」，表示憑借。《馬王堆．老子乙本．道經》：「為而弗侍(恃)也，成功而弗居也。」《儀禮．士昬禮》：「媵侍於戶外，呼則聞。」鄭玄注：「今文侍作待。」參見「 寺 」、「 待 」、「 恃 」。
" Servant" follows the sound of " person" and " temple", which means to serve and to accompany the venerable. "Said Wen": "Serve, inherit. From the person, the temple sound." Duan Yucai's note: "The inheritor, the honor, the accept. All the servants are respectful and respectful of the righteousness." "Liu Shu Gu. Ren Yi: "Serve, accompany the side." "The Analects. "Advanced": "Min Zi is on the side, and talks as if it is too." Xing Bingshu: "Being humble and calling on the side is called the servant. The characters on the bamboo and silk are from the people from the temple, the people are the righteous symbols, and the temple is the sound symbol, which is the same as the Xiaozhuan. " Patient" can be used as " waiting", meaning waiting. Such as "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Slips. "Closed Diagnosis Ceremony": "Serving (waiting) order". It also means " reliance", which means relying on it. "Mawangdui. Laozi B this. "Tao Jing": "For the sake of Fu Shi (reliance), success and Fu Ju also." "Ritual. Shizhu Li": "The maid waits outdoors, and when you call it, you hear it." Zheng Xuan's note: "The present text serves as a waiter." See " Temple", " Waiting", " Reliance".

侍字的基本解释

侍
shì
伺候，在旁边陪着：服侍。侍立。侍者（侍奉左右的人）。侍从。侍读（给帝王讲学的人）。侍坐。侍役（仆人）。

侍字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shì］
［《廣韻》時吏切，去志，禪。］
“寺2”的今字。
(1)陪从或伺候尊长、主人。
(2)奉养；赡养。
(3)特指进谏，进言。
(4)侍妾；侍女。
(5)泛指侍奉随从者。
(6)司，掌管。
(7)通“恃”。
(8)通“待”。
(9)姓。

侍字的英文翻译

◎ 侍
serve, wait upon

侍字的康熙字典解释

【子集中】【人字部】　侍； 康熙笔画：8； 页码：页101第26
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?時吏切，音耆。【說文】承也。【廣韻】近也，從也。【六書故】陪側也。【禮·曲禮】侍坐于先生。　又常侍，漢時宦官名，後遂沿習爲士人官制。如唐高適稱高常侍，李愬稱李常侍是也。　又【史記·趙世家】公仲連進牛畜荀欣徐越。畜侍以仁義，欣侍以舉賢使能，越侍以節財儉用。【註】侍猶勸也。　又侍其，複姓。宋侍其良器。

考證：〔【史記·魏世家】公仲連進牛畜荀欣徐越。畜侍以仁義，欣侍以舉賢使能，越侍以節財儉用。〕　謹照原書魏世家改趙世家。
侍字的源字形

侍字的起名意思

在尊长旁边陪着。

Serve
Basic explanation of words
Serve
shì
Serve, accompany by the side: Serve. Paternity. Waiter (the person who serves the left and right). Attendant. Attendant (the person who gives lectures to the emperor). Waiter. Servant (servant).
Serve
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［shì］
["Guangyun", when the officials cut, go to Zhi, Zen. ]
The present word for "Temple 2".
(1) To accompany or serve the elder and master.
(2) Support; support.
(3) Especially referring to admonition, admonition.
(4) Concubine; maid.
(5) Refers to the servants in general.
(6) Secretary, in charge.
(7) Through "reliance".
(8) Through "waiting".
(9) Last name.

[Subset] [Human Character Department] 　Shi; Kangxi Strokes: 8; Page Number: Page 101 26
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Zheng Yun]? It’s time to cut, and the sound is senior. [Said Wen] Cheng Ye. [Guang Yun] Nearly, Congye. [Six Books] To accompany the side. 【Li·Qu Li】Serve Mr. Yu.　He often served as an eunuch in the Han Dynasty, and then followed the practice as a sergeant system. For example, Tang Gaoshi is called Gao Changshi, and Li Yun called Li Changshi.　[Historical Records · Family of Zhao Family] Gong Zhong even entered cattle and livestock Xun Xin Xu Yue. The animal servants are benevolent and righteous, the gracious servants are able to promote talents, and the more servants are used to save money. [Note] Shiyou persuades too.　I serve him again, and his surname is restored. Song Shiqi is a good tool. Textual research: [[Historical Records·Wei Family] Gong Zhong Lian entered cattle and livestock Xun Xin Xu Yue. The animal servants are benevolent and righteous, the gracious servants are able to promote talents, and the more servants are used to save money. 〕　I would like to change the original book of Wei Shijia to Zhao Shijia.

Я также слушал короля золота, которого проверили в Интернете из Сайбея, подозревая
shì
I гл.
1) прислуживать, обслуживать, ухаживать за; состоять при (ком-л.; для услуг, поручений, в свите)
侍老抚幼 ухаживать за престарелыми, опекать малолетних
亲侍 лично прислуживать
2) помогать, ассистировать в (чем-л.); присутствовать при
侍祀 помогать в жертвоприношении, присутствовать при молении
侍市栉 помогать полотенцем и гребнем (обр. быть женой, наложницей)
II сущ.
1) ( сокр. вм. 侍生) ассистент; вежл. я, Ваш покорный слуга
2) яп. самурай
III собств.
Ши (фамилия)
Radicals: ｲ, 寺  (leader, temple)
Meaning Mnemonic
The leader of the temple isn't a monk like you'd expect. It's a samurai, who protects the monks in return for prayers that keep him safe.
You walk up to a temple and you're surprised to find that there's a samurai guarding it. Talk to him for a while so he can tell you why he has been doing this job. He's quite a nice guy, actually.
Reading Mnemonic
The reading is samurai, which should be easy enough to remember.
If you know the meaning you know the reading as well! That doesn't happen too often with kanji, so consider yourself lucky!
